props.name: value
props.description: An array of objects to display.

props.name: dataKey
props.description: Name of the field that uniquely identifies the a record in the data.

props.name: rows
props.description: Number of rows to display per page.

props.name: first
props.description: Index of the first row to be displayed.

props.name: totalRecords
props.description: Number of total records, defaults to length of value when not defined.

props.name: paginator
props.description: When specified as true, enables the pagination.

props.name: paginatorPosition
props.description: Position of the paginator, options are 'top','bottom' or 'both'.

props.name: alwaysShowPaginator
props.description: Whether to show it even there is only one page.

props.name: paginatorTemplate
props.default: FirstPageLink PrevPageLink PageLinks NextPageLink LastPageLink RowsPerPageDropdown
props.description:
Template of the paginator. It can be customized using the template property using the predefined keys.

- FirstPageLink
- PrevPageLink
- PageLinks
- NextPageLink
- LastPageLink
- RowsPerPageDropdown
- JumpToPageDropdown
- JumpToPageInput
- CurrentPageReport

props.name: pageLinkSize
props.description: Number of page links to display.

props.name: rowsPerPageOptions
props.description: Array of integer values to display inside rows per page dropdown.

props.name: currentPageReportTemplate
lazy
props.description: Defines if data is loaded and interacted with in lazy manner.

props.name: loading
props.description: Displays a loader to indicate data load is in progress.

props.name: loadingIcon
props.description: The icon to show while indicating data load is in progress.

props.name: sortField
props.description: Property name or a getter function of a row data used for sorting by default

props.name: sortOrder
props.description: Order to sort the data by default.

props.name: nullSortOrder
props.description: Determines how null values are sorted.

props.name: defaultSortOrder
props.description: Default sort order of an unsorted column.

props.name: multiSortMeta
props.description: An array of SortMeta objects to sort the data.

props.name: sortMode
props.description: Defines whether sorting works on single column or on multiple columns.

props.name: removableSort
props.description: When enabled, columns can have an un-sorted state.

props.name: filters
props.description: Filters object with key-value pairs to define the filters.

props.name: filterDisplay
props.description: Layout of the filter elements.

props.name: globalFilterFields
props.description: An array of fields as string or function to use in global filtering.

props.name: filterLocale
props.description: Locale to use in filtering. The default locale is the host environment's current locale.

props.name: selection
props.description: Selected row in single mode or an array of values in multiple mode.

props.name: selectionMode
props.description: Specifies the selection mode.

props.name: compareSelectionBy
props.description: Algorithm to define if a row is selected.

props.name: metaKeySelection
props.description:
Defines whether metaKey is requred or not for the selection. When true metaKey needs to be pressed to select or unselect an item and
when set to false selection of each item can be toggled individually. On touch enabled devices, metaKeySelection is turned off automatically.

props.name: contextMenu
props.description: Enables context menu integration.

components.name: dataview
components.title: Vue DataView Component
components.description: DataView displays data in grid or list layout with pagination and sorting features.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader The container element that wraps the layout options buttons has a group role whereas each button element uses button role and aria-pressed is updated depending on selection state. Values to describe the buttons are derived from the aria.listView and aria.gridView properties of the locale API respectively. Refer to paginator accessibility documentation for the paginator of the component. Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus to the buttons. space Toggles the checked state of a button.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: DataView requires a value to display along with a list slot for item content.

examples.data:
/* ProductService */
{
    id: '1000',
    code: 'f230fh0g3',
    name: 'Bamboo Watch',
    description: 'Product Description',
    image: 'bamboo-watch.jpg',
    price: 65,
    category: 'Accessories',
    quantity: 24,
    inventoryStatus: 'INSTOCK',
    rating: 5
},
...

examples.basic: import DataView from 'primevue/dataview';

sections.label: Layout
sections.description: DataView supports list and grid display modes defined with the layout property. The grid mode is not built-in for flexibility purposes and requires a library with CSS grid features like Tailwind.

examples.data:
/* ProductService */
{
    id: '1000',
    code: 'f230fh0g3',
    name: 'Bamboo Watch',
    description: 'Product Description',
    image: 'bamboo-watch.jpg',
    price: 65,
    category: 'Accessories',
    quantity: 24,
    inventoryStatus: 'INSTOCK',
    rating: 5
},
...

sections.label: Loading
sections.description: While data is being loaded, Skeleton component may be used to indicate the busy state.

    quantity: 24,
    inventoryStatus: 'INSTOCK',

...

sections.description: Pagination is enabled with the paginator and rows properties. Refer to the Paginator for more information about customizing the paginator.

examples.data:

    price: 65,
    category: 'Accessories',
    quantity: 24,
    inventoryStatus: 'INSTOCK',

sections.description: Built-in sorting is controlled by bindings sortField and sortField properties from a custom UI.

components.name: datepicker
components.title: Vue DatePicker Component
components.description: DatePicker is a form component for date inputs.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Value to describe the component can either be provided via label tag combined with inputId prop or using aria-labelledby , aria-label props. The input element has combobox role in addition to aria-autocomplete as "none", aria-haspopup as "dialog" and aria-expanded attributes. The relation between the input and the popup is created with aria-controls attribute that refers to the id of the popup. The optional datepicker button requires includes aria-haspopup , aria-expanded for states along with aria-controls to define the relation between the popup and the button. The value to read is retrieved from the chooseDate key of the aria property from the locale API. This label is also used for the aria-label of the popup as well. When there is a value selected, it is formatted and appended to the label to be able to notify users about the current value. Popup has a dialog role along with aria-modal and aria-label . The navigation buttons at the header has an aria-label retrieved from the prevYear , nextYear , prevMonth , nextMonth , prevDecade and nextDecade keys of the locale aria API. Similarly month picker button uses the chooseMonth and year picker button uses the chooseYear keys. Main date table uses grid role that contains th elements with col as the scope along with abbr tag resolving to the full name of the month. Each date cell has an aria-label referring to the full date value. Buttons at the footer utilize their readable labels as aria-label as well. Selected date also receives the aria-selected attribute. Timepicker spinner buttons get their labels for aria-label from the aria locale API using the prevHour , nextHour , prevMinute , nextMinute , prevSecond , nextSecond , am and pm keys. DatePicker also includes a hidden section that is only available to screen readers with aria-live as "polite". This element is updated when the selected date changes to instruct the user about the current date selected. Choose Date Button Keyboard Support Key Function space Opens popup and moves focus to the selected date, if there is none focuses on today. enter Opens popup and moves focus to the selected date, if there is none focuses on today. Popup Keyboard Support Key Function escape Closes the popup and moves focus to the input element. tab Moves focus to the next focusable element within the popup. shift + tab Moves focus to the next focusable element within the popup. Header Buttons Keyboard Support Key Function enter Triggers the button action. space Triggers the button action. Date Grid Keyboard Support Key Function enter Selects the date, closes the popup and moves focus to the input element. space Closes the popup and moves focus to the input element. up arrow Moves focus to the same day of the previous week. alt + up arrow Closes the popup and moves focus to the input element. down arrow Moves focus to the same day of the next week. right arrow Moves focus to the next day. left arrow Moves focus to the previous day. home Moves focus to the first day of the current week. end Moves focus to the last day of the current week. page up Changes the date to previous month in date picker mode. Moves to previous year in month picker mode and previous decade in year picker. shift + page up Changes the date to previous year in date picker mode. Has no effect in month or year picker. page down Changes the date to next month in date picker mode. Moves to next year in month picker mode and next decade in year picker. shift + page down Changes the date to next year in date picker mode. Has no effect in month or year picker. Footer Buttons Keyboard Support Key Function enter Triggers the button action. space Triggers the button action.

examples.basic: Date

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: DatePicker is used with the v-model property for two-way value binding.

examples.basic: <DatePicker v-model="date" />

sections.label: ButtonBarDoc
sections.description: When showButtonBar is present, today and clear buttons are displayed at the footer. The content can be fully customized with the buttonbar slot as well.

sections.label: Clear Icon
sections.description: When showClear is enabled, a clear icon is added to reset the DatePicker.

examples.basic: <DatePicker v-model="date" showClear />

sections.label: Date Template
sections.description: Custom content can be placed inside date cells with the date slot that takes a Date as a parameter.

sections.label: Disabled
sections.description: DatePicker is used a controlled input component with v-model property.

examples.basic: <DatePicker v-model="date" disabled />

sections.label: Filled
sections.description: Specify the variant property as filled to display the component with a higher visual emphasis than the default outlined style.

examples.basic: <DatePicker v-model="date" variant="filled" />

sections.label: Float Label
sections.description: A floating label appears on top of the input field when focused. Visit FloatLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<FloatLabel>
    <DatePicker v-model="value1" inputId="over_label" showIcon iconDisplay="input" />
    <label for="over_label">Over Label</label>
</FloatLabel>

<FloatLabel variant="in">
    <DatePicker v-model="value2" inputId="in_label" showIcon iconDisplay="input" variant="filled" />
    <label for="in_label">In Label</label>
</FloatLabel>

<FloatLabel variant="on">
    <DatePicker v-model="value3" inputId="on_label" showIcon iconDisplay="input" />
    <label for="on_label">On Label</label>
</FloatLabel>

sections.label: Fluid
sections.description: The fluid prop makes the component take up the full width of its container when set to true.

examples.basic: <DatePicker v-model="date" fluid />

sections.label: Format
sections.description: Default date format is mm/dd/yy which can be customized using the dateFormat property. Following options can be a part of the format. d - day of month (no leading zero) dd - day of month (two digit) o - day of the year (no leading zeros) oo - day of the year (three digit) D - day name short DD - day name long m - month of year (no leading zero) mm - month of year (two digit) M - month name short MM - month name long y - year (two digit) yy - year (four digit) @ - Unix timestamp (ms since 01/01/1970) ! - Windows ticks (100ns since 01/01/0001) '...' - literal text '' - single quote anything else - literal text

examples.basic: <DatePicker v-model="date" dateFormat="dd/mm/yy" />

sections.label: Forms
sections.description: DatePicker integrates seamlessly with the PrimeVue Forms library.

examples.basic: {{ $form.date.error?.message }}

sections.label: Icon
sections.description: An additional icon is displayed next to the input field when showIcon is present.

examples.basic:
<DatePicker v-model="buttondisplay" showIcon fluid :showOnFocus="false" />
<DatePicker v-model="icondisplay" showIcon fluid iconDisplay="input" />
<DatePicker v-model="templatedisplay" showIcon fluid iconDisplay="input" timeOnly>
    <template #inputicon="slotProps">
        <i class="pi pi-clock" @click="slotProps.clickCallback" />
    </template>
</DatePicker>

sections.label: Ifta Label
sections.description: IftaLabel is used to create infield top aligned labels. Visit IftaLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<IftaLabel>
    <DatePicker v-model="value" inputId="date" showIcon iconDisplay="input" variant="filled" />
    <label for="date">Date</label>
</IftaLabel>
import DatePicker from 'primevue/datepicker';

sections.label: Inline
sections.description: DatePicker is displayed as a popup by default, add inline property to customize this behavior.

examples.basic: <DatePicker v-model="date" inline showWeek class="w-full sm:w-[30rem]" />

sections.label: Invalid
sections.description: Invalid state is displayed using the invalid prop to indicate a failed validation. You can use this style when integrating with form validation libraries.

examples.basic:
<DatePicker v-model="date1" :invalid="!date1" placeholder="Date" />
<DatePicker v-model="date2" :invalid="!date2" variant="filled" placeholder="Date" />

sections.label: Locale
sections.description: Locale for different languages and formats is defined globally, refer to the PrimeVue Locale configuration for more information.

sections.label: Min / Max
sections.description: Boundaries for the permitted dates that can be entered are defined with minDate and maxDate properties.

examples.basic: <DatePicker v-model="date" :minDate="minDate" :maxDate="maxDate" :manualInput="false" />

sections.label: Model Type
sections.description: The updateModelType property controls the data type of the value. When set to string it returns a string representation of the date, when set to date (default) it returns a Date object.

examples.basic:
<DatePicker v-model="dateTypeModel" />
<DatePicker v-model="stringTypeModel" updateModelType="string" />

sections.label: Month Picker
sections.description: Month only picker is enabled by specifying view as month in addition to a suitable dateFormat .

examples.basic: <DatePicker v-model="date" view="month" dateFormat="mm/yy" />

sections.label: Multiple
sections.description: In order to choose multiple dates, set selectionMode as multiple . In this mode, the value binding should be an array.

examples.basic: <DatePicker v-model="dates" selectionMode="multiple" :manualInput="false" />

sections.label: Multiple Months
sections.description: Number of months to display is configured with the numberOfMonths property.

examples.basic: <DatePicker v-model="date" :numberOfMonths="2" />

sections.label: Range
sections.description: A range of dates can be selected by defining selectionMode as range , in this case the bound value would be an array with two values where first date is the start of the range and second date is the end.

examples.basic: <DatePicker v-model="dates" selectionMode="range" :manualInput="false" />

sections.label: Sizes
sections.description: DatePicker provides small and large sizes as alternatives to the base.

examples.basic:
<DatePicker v-model="value1" size="small" placeholder="Small" showIcon iconDisplay="input" />
<DatePicker v-model="value2" placeholder="Normal" showIcon iconDisplay="input" />
<DatePicker v-model="value3" size="large" placeholder="Large" showIcon iconDisplay="input" />

sections.label: Time
sections.description: A time picker is displayed when showTime is enabled where 12/24 hour format is configured with hourFormat property. In case, only time needs to be selected, add timeOnly to hide the date section.

examples.basic:
<DatePicker id="datepicker-12h" v-model="datetime12h" showTime hourFormat="12" fluid />
<DatePicker id="datepicker-24h" v-model="datetime24h" showTime hourFormat="24" fluid />
<DatePicker id="datepicker-timeonly" v-model="time" timeOnly fluid />

sections.label: Year Picker
sections.description: Specifying view as year in addition to a suitable dateFormat enables the year picker.

examples.basic: <DatePicker v-model="date" view="year" dateFormat="yy" />

props.name: modelValue
props.description: Value of the component.

props.name: defaultValue
props.description: The default value for the input when not controlled by  `modelValue` .

props.name: name
props.description: The name attribute for the element, typically used in form submissions.

props.name: selectionMode
props.description: Defines the quantity of the selection.

props.name: dateFormat
props.description: Format of the date. Defaults to PrimeVue Locale configuration.

props.name: updateModelType
props.description: Type of the value to write back to modelValue.

props.name: inline
props.description: When enabled, displays the datepicker as inline instead of an overlay.

props.name: showOtherMonths
props.description: Whether to display dates in other months (non-selectable) at the start or end of the current month. To make these days selectable use the selectOtherMonths option.

props.name: selectOtherMonths
props.description: Whether days in other months shown before or after the current month are selectable. This only applies if the showOtherMonths option is set to true.

props.name: showIcon
props.description: When enabled, displays a button with icon next to input.

props.name: iconDisplay
props.description: Icon position of the component. This only applies if the showIcon option is set to true.

props.name: icon
props.description: Icon of the datepicker button.

props.name: prevIcon
props.description: Icon to show in the previous button.

props.name: nextIcon
props.description: Icon to show in the next button.

props.name: incrementIcon
props.description: Icon to show in each of the increment buttons.

props.name: decrementIcon
props.description: Icon to show in each of the decrement buttons.

props.name: numberOfMonths
props.description: Number of months to display.

props.name: responsiveOptions
props.description: An array of options for responsive design.

props.name: breakpoint
props.description: The breakpoint to define the maximum width boundary for datepicker panel.

props.name: view
props.description: Type of view to display.

props.name: minDate
props.description: The minimum selectable date.

props.name: maxDate
props.description: The maximum selectable date.

props.name: disabledDates
props.description: Array with dates to disable.

props.name: disabledDays
props.description: Array with disabled weekday numbers.

props.name: maxDateCount
props.description: Maximum number of selectable dates in multiple mode.

props.name: showOnFocus
props.description: When disabled, datepicker will not be visible with input focus.

props.name: autoZIndex
props.description: Whether to automatically manage layering.

props.name: baseZIndex
props.description: Base zIndex value to use in layering.

props.name: showButtonBar
props.description: Whether to display today and clear buttons at the footer.

props.name: shortYearCutoff
props.description: The cutoff year for determining the century for a date.

props.name: showTime
props.description: Whether to display timepicker.

props.name: timeOnly
props.description: Whether to display timepicker only.

props.name: hourFormat
props.description: Specifies hour format.

props.name: stepHour
props.description: Hours to change per step.

props.name: stepMinute
props.description: Minutes to change per step.

props.name: stepSecond
props.description: Seconds to change per step.

props.name: showSeconds
props.description: Whether to show the seconds in time picker.

props.name: hideOnDateTimeSelect

components.name: deferredcontent
components.title: Vue Deferred Content Component
components.description: DeferredContent postpones the loading the content that is initially not in the viewport until it becomes visible on scroll.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader DeferredContent can be utilized in many use cases as a result no role is enforced, in fact a role may not be necessary if the card is used for presentational purposes only. Any valid attribute is passed to the container element so you have full control over the roles like landmark and attributes like aria-live . Keyboard Support Component does not include any interactive elements.

examples.basic:
<DeferredContent role="region" aria-live="polite" aria-label="Content loaded after page scrolled down">
    Content
</DeferredContent>

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: DeferredContent is used by wrapping the target.

sections.label: DataTable
sections.description: A practical example that triggers a fetch when the table becomes visible in viewport.

examples.basic:
<DeferredContent @load="onDataLoad" role="region" aria-live="polite" aria-label="Content loaded after page scrolled down">
    <DataTable :value="products">
        <Column field="code" header="Code"></Column>
        <Column field="name" header="Name"></Column>
        <Column field="category" header="Category"></Column>
        <Column field="quantity" header="Quantity"></Column>
    </DataTable>
</DeferredContent>
import DeferredContent from 'primevue/deferredcontent';

components.name: dialog
components.title: Vue Dialog Component
components.description: Dialog is a container to display content in an overlay window.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Dialog component uses dialog role along with aria-labelledby referring to the header element however any attribute is passed to the root element so you may use aria-labelledby to override this default behavior. In addition aria-modal is added since focus is kept within the popup. Trigger element also requires aria-expanded and aria-controls to be handled explicitly. Close element is a button with an aria-label that refers to the aria.close property of the locale API by default, you may use closeButtonProps to customize the element and override the default aria-label . Overlay Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus to the next the focusable element within the dialog if modal is true. Otherwise, the focusable element in the page tab sequence. shift + tab Moves focus to the previous the focusable element within the dialog if modal is true. Otherwise, the focusable element in the page tab sequence. escape Closes the dialog if closeOnEscape is true. Close Button Keyboard Support Key Function enter Closes the dialog. space Closes the dialog.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Dialog is used as a container and visibility is controlled with a binding to visible property.

sections.label: Headless
sections.description: Headless mode is enabled by defining a container slot that lets you implement entire UI instead of the default elements.

examples.basic: import Dialog from 'primevue/dialog';

sections.label: Long Content
sections.description: When content exceeds viewport, Dialog automatically becomes scrollable.

sections.label: Maximizable
sections.description: Adding maximizable property enables the full screen mode.

sections.label: Position
sections.description: The position property defines the location of relative to the screen.

examples.basic: Update your information.

sections.label: Responsive
sections.description: Dialog width can be adjusted per screen size with the breakpoints option where the max-width for the breakpoint and the width are defined as key-value pairs. When no breakpoint matches width defined in style or class is used. Alternatively responsive utility classes of libraries like Tailwind can also be used such as md:w-screen .

sections.label: Template
sections.description: Header and Footer sections allow customization via templating.

sections.label: WithoutModalDoc
sections.description: Mask layer behind the Dialog is configured with the modal property. By default, no modal layer is added.

components.name: dock
components.title: Vue Dock Component
components.description: Dock is a navigation component consisting of menuitems.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Dock component uses the menu role with the aria-orientation and the value to describe the menu can either be provided with aria-labelledby or aria-label props. Each list item has a menuitem role with aria-label referring to the label of the item and aria-disabled defined if the item is disabled. Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus to the first menuitem. enter Activates the focused menuitem. space Activates the focused menuitem. down arrow Moves focus to the next menuitem in vertical layout. up arrow Moves focus to the previous menuitem in vertical layout. right arrow Moves focus to the next menuitem in horizontal layout. left arrow Moves focus to the previous menuitem in horizontal layout. home Moves focus to the first menuitem. end Moves focus to the last menuitem.

sections.label: AdvancedDoc
sections.description: A mock desktop UI implemented with various components in addition to Dock.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Dock requires a collection of menuitems as its model and an icon template. Default location is bottom and other edges are also available when defined with the position property.

examples.basic: import Dock from 'primevue/dock';

props.description: Icon element binding

components.name: drawer
components.title: Vue Drawer Component
components.description: Drawer is a container component displayed as an overlay.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Drawer component uses complementary role by default, since any attribute is passed to the root element aria role can be changed depending on your use case and additional attributes like aria-labelledby can be added. In addition aria-modal is added since focus is kept within the drawer when opened. Trigger element also requires aria-expanded and aria-controls to be handled explicitly. Overlay Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus to the next the focusable element within the drawer. shift + tab Moves focus to the previous the focusable element within the drawer. escape Closes the drawer. Close Button Keyboard Support Key Function enter Closes the drawer. space Closes the drawer.

components.name: dynamicdialog
components.title: Vue Dynamic Dialog Component
components.description: Dialogs can be created dynamically with any component as the content using a DialogService.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Visit accessibility section of dialog component for more information.

sections.label: CloseDialogDoc
sections.description: The close function is available through a dialogRef that is injected to the component loaded by the dialog.

sections.label: Customization
sections.description: DynamicDialog uses the Dialog component internally, visit dialog for more information about the available props.

sections.label: Dialog Service
sections.description: A single shared dialog instance is required in the application, ideal location would be defining it once at the main application template. A dynamic dialog is controlled via the DialogService that needs to be installed as an application plugin. The service is available with the useDialog function for Composition API or using the $dialog property of the application for Options API.

sections.label: Events
sections.description: The emits object defines callbacks to handle events emitted by the component within the Dialog.

sections.label: Example
sections.description: A sample implementation to demonstrate loading components asynchronously, nested content and passing data.

examples.basic:
<Button label="Select a Product" icon="pi pi-search" @click="showProducts" />

<DynamicDialog />
examples.data:
/* ProductService */
{
    id: '1000',
    code: 'f230fh0g3',
    name: 'Bamboo Watch',
    description: 'Product Description',
    image: 'bamboo-watch.jpg',
    price: 65,
    category: 'Accessories',
    quantity: 24,
    inventoryStatus: 'INSTOCK',
    rating: 5
},
...

examples.basic: import DynamicDialog from 'primevue/dynamicdialog';

sections.label: OpenDialogDoc
sections.description: The open function of the DialogService is used to open a Dialog. First parameter is the component to load and second one is the configuration object to customize the Dialog. The component can also be loaded asynchronously, this approach is useful in conditional cases and to improve initial load times as well.

sections.label: Passing Data
sections.description: Use the data property to pass parameters when opening a Dialog, the internal component can later access this data using dialogRef . Similarly when hiding a Dialog, any parameter passed to the close function is received from the onClose callback.

components.title: Vue Editor Component
components.description: Editor is rich text editor component based on Quill.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Quill performs generally well in terms of accessibility. The elements in the toolbar can be tabbed and have the necessary ARIA roles/attributes for screen readers. One known limitation is the lack of arrow key support for dropdowns in the toolbar that may be overcome with a custom toolbar.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Editor is used with the v-model property for two-way value binding.

examples.basic: <Editor v-model="value" editorStyle="height: 320px" />

sections.label: Forms
sections.description: Editor integrates seamlessly with the PrimeVue Forms library.

examples.basic: {{ $form.content.error?.message }}

sections.label: Template
sections.description: Editor provides a default toolbar with common options, to customize it define your elements inside the header element. Refer to Quill documentation for available controls.

components.name: fieldset
components.title: Vue Fieldset Component
components.description: Fieldset is a grouping component with a content toggle feature.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Fieldset component uses the semantic fieldset element. When toggleable option is enabled, a button element is included inside the legend element, this button has aria-controls to define the id of the content section along with aria-expanded for the visibility state. The value to read the button defaults to the value of the legend property and can be customized by defining an aria-label or aria-labelledby via the toggleButtonProps property. The content uses region , defines an id that matches the aria-controls of the content toggle button and aria-labelledby referring to the id of the header. Content Toggle Button Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus to the next the focusable element in the page tab sequence. shift + tab Moves focus to the previous the focusable element in the page tab sequence. enter Toggles the visibility of the content. space Toggles the visibility of the content.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: A simple Fieldset is created with a legend property along with the content as children.

components.name: fileupload
components.title: Vue File Upload Component
components.description: FileUpload is an advanced uploader with dragdrop support, multi file uploads, auto uploading, progress tracking and validations.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader FileUpload uses a hidden native input element with type="file" for screen readers. Keyboard Support Interactive elements of the uploader are buttons, visit the Button accessibility section for more information.

sections.label: Advanced
sections.description: Advanced uploader provides dragdrop support, multi file uploads, auto uploading, progress tracking and validations.

sections.label: Auto
sections.description: When auto property is enabled, a file gets uploaded instantly after selection.

<Button label="Upload" @click="upload" severity="secondary" />

components.name: floatlabel
components.title: Vue Float Label
components.description: FloatLabel visually integrates a label with its form element.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader FloatLabel does not require any roles and attributes. Keyboard Support Component does not include any interactive elements.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: FloatLabel is used by wrapping the input and its label.

examples.basic:
<FloatLabel>
    <InputText id="username" v-model="value" />
    <label for="username">Username</label>
</FloatLabel>
import FloatLabel from 'primevue/floatlabel';

sections.label: Invalid
sections.description: When the form element is invalid, the label is also highlighted.

examples.basic:
<FloatLabel>
    <InputText id="value1" v-model="value1" :invalid="!value1" />
    <label for="value1">Username</label>
</FloatLabel>

<FloatLabel variant="in">
    <InputText id="value2" v-model="value2" :invalid="!value2" />
    <label for="value2">Username</label>
</FloatLabel>

<FloatLabel variant="on">
    <InputText id="value3" v-model="value3" :invalid="!value3" />
    <label for="value3">Username</label>
</FloatLabel>

sections.label: Variants
sections.description: The variant property defines the position of the label. Default value is over , whereas in and on are the alternatives.

examples.basic:
<FloatLabel variant="in">
    <InputText id="in_label" v-model="value1" autocomplete="off" />
    <label for="in_label">In Label</label>
</FloatLabel>

<FloatLabel variant="on">
    <InputText id="on_label" v-model="value2" autocomplete="off" />
    <label for="on_label">On Label</label>
</FloatLabel>

components.name: galleria
components.title: Vue Gallery Component
components.description: Galleria is a content gallery component.

sections.label: AccessibilityDoc
sections.description: Screen Reader Galleria uses region role and since any attribute is passed to the main container element, attributes such as aria-label and aria-roledescription can be used as well. The slides container has aria-live attribute set as "polite" if galleria is not in autoplay mode, otherwise "off" would be the value in autoplay. A slide has a group role with an aria-label that refers to the aria.slideNumber property of the locale API. Similarly aria.slide is used as the aria-roledescription of the item. Inactive slides are hidden from the readers with aria-hidden . Next and Previous navigators are button elements with aria-label attributes referring to the aria.prevPageLabel and aria.nextPageLabel properties of the locale API by default respectively, you may still use your own aria roles and attributes as any valid attribute is passed to the button elements implicitly by using nextButtonProps and prevButtonProps . Quick navigation elements and thumnbails follow the tab pattern. They are placed inside an element with a tablist role whereas each item has a tab role with aria-selected and aria-controls attributes. The aria-label attribute of a quick navigation item refers to the aria.pageLabel of the locale API. Current page is marked with aria-current . In full screen mode, modal element uses dialog role with aria-modal enabled. The close button retrieves aria-label from the aria.close property of the locale API. Next/Prev Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus through interactive elements in the carousel. enter Activates navigation. space Activates navigation. Quick Navigation Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus through the active slide link. enter Activates the focused slide link. space Activates the focused slide link. right arrow Moves focus to the next slide link. left arrow Moves focus to the previous slide link. home Moves focus to the first slide link. end Moves focus to the last slide link.

sections.label: AdvancedDoc
sections.description: Advanced Galleria implementation with a custom UI.

sections.label: AutoPlayDoc
sections.description: A slideshow implementation is defined by adding circular and autoPlay properties.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Galleria requires a value as a collection of images, item template for the higher resolution image and thumbnail template to display as a thumbnail.

sections.label: CaptionDoc
sections.description: Description of an image is specified with the caption property that takes the displayed object and returns content.

sections.label: Controlled
sections.description: Galleria can be controlled programmatically using a binding to activeIndex .

examples.basic: import Galleria from 'primevue/galleria';

sections.label: ResponsiveDoc
sections.description: Settings per screen size is defined via the responsiveOptions property.

sections.label: ThumbnailDoc
sections.description: Thumbnails represent a smaller version of the actual content.

components.name: iconfield
components.title: Vue IconField
components.description: IconField wraps an input and an icon.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader IconField and InputIcon do not require any roles and attributes. Keyboard Support Components does not include any interactive elements.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: IconField wraps the InputIcon and the input field component.

examples.basic:
<IconField>
    <InputIcon class="pi pi-search" />
    <InputText v-model="value1" placeholder="Search" />
</IconField>

<IconField>
    <InputText v-model="value2" variant="filled" />
    <InputIcon class="pi pi-spin pi-spinner" />
</IconField>

sections.label: Float Label
sections.description: FloatLabel visually integrates a label with its form element. Visit FloatLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<FloatLabel>
    <IconField>
        <InputIcon class="pi pi-search" />
        <InputText id="over_label" v-model="value1" autocomplete="off" />
    </IconField>
    <label for="over_label">Over Label</label>
</FloatLabel>

<FloatLabel variant="in">
    <IconField>
        <InputIcon class="pi pi-search" />
        <InputText id="in_label" v-model="value2" autocomplete="off" variant="filled" />
    </IconField>
    <label for="in_label">In Label</label>
</FloatLabel>

<FloatLabel variant="on">
    <IconField>
        <InputIcon class="pi pi-search" />
        <InputText id="on_label" v-model="value3" autocomplete="off" />
    </IconField>
    <label for="on_label">On Label</label>
</FloatLabel>

sections.label: Ifta Label
sections.description: IftaLabel is used to create infield top aligned labels. Visit IftaLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<IftaLabel>
    <IconField>
        <InputIcon class="pi pi-user" />
        <InputText id="username" v-model="value" variant="filled" />
    </IconField>
    <label for="username">Username</label>
</IftaLabel>

import IconField from 'primevue/iconfield';
import InputIcon from 'primevue/inputicon';

sections.label: Sizes
sections.description: IconField is compatible with the size setting of the input field.

examples.basic:
<IconField>
    <InputIcon class="pi pi-search" />
    <InputText v-model="value1" placeholder="Small" size="small" />
</IconField>

<IconField>
    <InputIcon class="pi pi-search" />
    <InputText v-model="value2" placeholder="Normal" />
</IconField>

<IconField>
    <InputText v-model="value3" placeholder="Large" size="large" />
    <InputIcon class="pi pi-spin pi-spinner" />
</IconField>

sections.label: Template
sections.description: Custom content inside an InputIcon is defined as children.

examples.basic:
<IconField>
    <InputIcon>
        <svg width="35" height="40" viewBox="0 0 35 40" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
            <path d="..." fill="var(--p-primary-color)" />
            <path d="..." fill="var(--p-text-color)" />
        </svg>
    </InputIcon>
    <InputText v-model="value" placeholder="Search" />
</IconField>

components.name: image
components.title: Vue Image Component
components.description: Displays a single image with preview and tranformation options.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader The preview button is a native button element with an aria-label that refers to the aria.zoomImage property of the locale API by default, with previewButtonProps you may use your own aria roles and attributes as any valid attribute is passed to the button element implicitly. When preview is active, dialog role with aria-modal is applied to the overlay image container. Button controls use aria.rotateRight , aria.rotateLeft , aria.zoomIn , aria.zoomOut and aria.close from the locale API as aria-label . ButtonBar Keyboard Support When preview is activated, close button receives the initial focus. Key Function tab Moves focus through button bar. enter Activates the button. space Activates the button. esc Closes the image preview.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Image is used similar to the standard img element.

examples.basic: <Image src="/image.jpg" alt="Image" width="250" />
import Image from 'primevue/image';

sections.label: Preview
sections.description: Enabling preview mode displays a modal layer when the image is clicked to provide transformation options such as rotating and zooming.

examples.basic: <Image src="/image.jpg" alt="Image" width="250" preview />

sections.label: Template
sections.description: An eye icon is displayed by default when the image is hovered in preview mode, use the previewicon slot for custom content. In addition, the image and preview slots are available to define the thumbnail and detailed image respectively.

components.name: imagecompare
components.title: Vue ImageCompare Component
components.description: Compare two images side by side with a slider.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader ImageComponent component uses a native range slider internally. Value to describe the component can be defined using aria-labelledby and aria-label props. Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus to the component. left arrow up arrow Decrements the value. right arrow down arrow Increments the value. home Set the minimum value. end Set the maximum value. page up Increments the value by 10 steps. page down Decrements the value by 10 steps.

examples.basic: Compare Images ... ...

components.name: inplace
components.title: Vue Inplace Component
components.description: Inplace provides an easy to do editing and display at the same time where clicking the output displays the actual content.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Inplace component defines aria-live as "polite" by default, since any valid attribute is passed to the main container aria roles and attributes of the root element can be customized easily. View Mode Keyboard Support Key Function enter Switches to content.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Inplace component requires display and content templates to define the content of each state.

sections.label: Image
sections.description: Any content such as an image can be placed inside an Inplace.

examples.basic: import Inplace from 'primevue/inplace';

sections.label: Input
sections.description: The closeCallback switches the state back to display mode when called from an event.

sections.label: Lazy
sections.description: The open event is used to initialize the content such as loading data in a lazy manner.

examples.basic:
<Inplace @open="loadData">
    <template #display> View Data </template>
    <template #content>
        <DataTable :value="products">
            <Column field="code" header="Code"></Column>
            <Column field="name" header="Name"></Column>
            <Column field="category" header="Category"></Column>
            <Column field="quantity" header="Quantity"></Column>
        </DataTable>
    </template>
</Inplace>

components.name: inputgroup
components.title: Vue InputGroup Component
components.description: Text, icon, buttons and other content can be grouped next to an input.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader InputGroup and InputGroupAddon do not require any roles and attributes. Keyboard Support Component does not include any interactive elements.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: A group is created by wrapping the input and add-ons with the InputGroup component. Each add-on element is defined as a child of InputGroupAddon component.

examples.basic: $ .00 www

sections.label: Button
sections.description: Buttons can be placed at either side of an input element.

examples.basic:
<InputGroup>
    <Button label="Search" />
    <InputText placeholder="Keyword" />
</InputGroup>

<InputGroup>
    <InputText placeholder="Keyword" />
    <InputGroupAddon>
        <Button icon="pi pi-search" severity="secondary" variant="text" @click="toggle" />
    </InputGroupAddon>
</InputGroup>
<Menu ref="menu" :model="items" popup class="!min-w-fit" />

<InputGroup>
    <InputGroupAddon>
        <Button icon="pi pi-check" severity="secondary" />
    </InputGroupAddon>
    <InputText placeholder="Vote" />
    <InputGroupAddon>
        <Button icon="pi pi-times" severity="secondary" />
    </InputGroupAddon>
</InputGroup>

sections.label: Checkbox & Radio
sections.description: Checkbox and RadioButton components can be combined with an input element under the same group.

examples.basic:
<InputGroup>
    <InputText placeholder="Price" />
    <InputGroupAddon>
        <RadioButton v-model="radioValue1" name="rb1" value="rb1" />
    </InputGroupAddon>
</InputGroup>

<InputGroup>
    <InputGroupAddon>
        <Checkbox v-model="checked1" :binary="true" />
    </InputGroupAddon>
    <InputText placeholder="Username" />
</InputGroup>

<InputGroup>
    <InputGroupAddon>
        <Checkbox v-model="checked2" :binary="true" />
    </InputGroupAddon>
    <InputText placeholder="Website" />
    <InputGroupAddon>
        <RadioButton v-model="radioValue2" name="rb2" value="rb2" />
    </InputGroupAddon>
</InputGroup>

components.name: inputmask
components.title: Vue Mask Component
components.description: InputMask component is used to enter input in a certain format such as numeric, date, currency, email and phone.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader InputMask component renders a native input element that implicitly includes any passed prop. Value to describe the component can either be provided via label tag combined with id prop or using aria-labelledby , aria-label props. Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus to the input.

examples.basic: Phone

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: InputMask is used with the v-model property for two-way value binding.

examples.basic: <InputMask id="basic" v-model="value" mask="99-999999" placeholder="99-999999" />

sections.label: Disabled
sections.description: When disabled is present, the element cannot be edited and focused.

examples.basic: <InputMask mask="99-999999" placeholder="Disabled" disabled />

sections.label: Filled
sections.description: Specify the variant property as filled to display the component with a higher visual emphasis than the default outlined style.

examples.basic: <InputMask id="basic" v-model="value" variant="filled" mask="99-999999" placeholder="99-999999" />

sections.label: Float Label
sections.description: FloatLabel visually integrates a label with its form element. Visit FloatLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<FloatLabel>
    <InputMask id="over_label" v-model="value1" mask="999-99-9999" />
    <label for="over_label">Over Label</label>
</FloatLabel>

<FloatLabel variant="in">
    <InputMask id="in_label" v-model="value2" mask="999-99-9999" variant="filled" />
    <label for="in_label">In Label</label>
</FloatLabel>

<FloatLabel variant="on">
    <InputMask id="on_label" v-model="value3" mask="999-99-9999" />
    <label for="on_label">On Label</label>
</FloatLabel>

sections.label: Fluid
sections.description: The fluid prop makes the component take up the full width of its container when set to true.

examples.basic: <InputMask v-model="value" fluid mask="99-999999" placeholder="99-999999" />

sections.label: Forms
sections.description: InputMask integrates seamlessly with the PrimeVue Forms library.

examples.basic: {{ $form.serialNumber.error?.message }}

sections.description: IftaLabel is used to create infield top aligned labels. Visit IftaLabel documentation for more information.

    <label for="ssn">SSN</label>

import InputMask from 'primevue/inputmask';

sections.label: Invalid
sections.description: Invalid state is displayed using the invalid prop to indicate a failed validation. You can use this style when integrating with form validation libraries.

examples.basic:
<InputMask v-model="value1" mask="99-999999" placeholder="Serial Key" :invalid="!value1" />
<InputMask v-model="value2" mask="99-999999" placeholder="Serial Key" :invalid="!value2" variant="filled" />

sections.label: Mask
sections.description: Mask format can be a combination of the following definitions; a for alphabetic characters, 9 for numeric characters and * for alphanumberic characters. In addition, formatting characters like ( , ) , - are also accepted.

sections.label: Optional
sections.description: When the input does not complete the mask definition, it is cleared by default. Use autoClear property to control this behavior. In addition, ? is used to mark anything after the question mark optional.

examples.basic: <InputMask v-model="value" mask="(999) 999-9999? x99999" placeholder="(999) 999-9999? x99999" />

sections.label: Sizes
sections.description: InputMask provides small and large sizes as alternatives to the base.

examples.basic:
<InputMask v-model="value1" placeholder="Small" size="small" mask="99-999999" />
<InputMask v-model="value2" placeholder="Normal" mask="99-999999" />
<InputMask v-model="value3" placeholder="Large" size="large" mask="99-999999" />

sections.label: SlotChar
sections.description: Default placeholder for a mask is underscore that can be customized using slotChar property.

examples.basic: <InputMask id="basic" v-model="value" placeholder="99/99/9999" mask="99/99/9999" slotChar="mm/dd/yyyy" />

props.name: modelValue

props.name: slotChar

props.name: autoClear
props.description: Clears the incomplete value on blur.

props.name: unmask
props.description: Defines if model sets the raw unmasked value to bound value or the formatted mask value.

props.name: readonly
props.description: Whether the items are clickable or not.

props.name: invalid

components.name: inputnumber
components.title: Vue InputNumber Component
components.description: InputNumber is an input component to provide numerical input.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Value to describe the component can either be provided via label tag combined with inputId prop or using aria-labelledby , aria-label props. The input element uses spinbutton role in addition to the aria-valuemin , aria-valuemax and aria-valuenow attributes. Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus to the input. up arrow Increments the value. down arrow Decrements the value. home Set the minimum value if provided. end Set the maximum value if provided.

examples.basic: Number

sections.label: Buttons
sections.description: Spinner buttons are enabled using the showButtons property and layout is defined with the buttonLayout .

examples.basic:
<InputNumber v-model="value1" inputId="stacked-buttons" showButtons mode="currency" currency="USD" fluid />
<InputNumber v-model="value2" inputId="minmax-buttons" mode="decimal" showButtons :min="0" :max="100" fluid />
<InputNumber v-model="value3" inputId="horizontal-buttons" showButtons buttonLayout="horizontal" :step="0.25" mode="currency" currency="EUR" fluid>
    <template #incrementbuttonicon>
        <span class="pi pi-plus" />
    </template>
    <template #decrementbuttonicon>
        <span class="pi pi-minus" />
    </template>
</InputNumber>

sections.label: Clear Icon
sections.description: When showClear is enabled, a clear icon is added to reset the InputNumber.

examples.basic: <InputNumber v-model="value" showClear />

sections.label: Currency
sections.description: Monetary values are enabled by setting mode property as currency . In this setting, currency property also needs to be defined using ISO 4217 standard such as "USD" for the US dollar.

examples.basic:
<InputNumber v-model="value1" inputId="currency-us" mode="currency" currency="USD" locale="en-US" fluid />
<InputNumber v-model="value2" inputId="currency-germany" mode="currency" currency="EUR" locale="de-DE" />
<InputNumber v-model="value3" inputId="currency-india" mode="currency" currency="INR" currencyDisplay="code" locale="en-IN" fluid />
<InputNumber v-model="value4" inputId="currency-japan" mode="currency" currency="JPY" locale="jp-JP" fluid />

sections.label: Disabled
sections.description: When disabled is present, the element cannot be edited and focused.

examples.basic: <InputNumber v-model="value" disabled prefix="%" />

sections.label: Filled
sections.description: Specify the variant property as filled to display the component with a higher visual emphasis than the default outlined style.

examples.basic: <InputNumber v-model="value" variant="filled" />

sections.label: Float Label
sections.description: A floating label appears on top of the input field when focused. Visit FloatLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<FloatLabel>
    <InputNumber v-model="value1" inputId="over_label" mode="currency" currency="USD" locale="en-US" />
    <label for="over_label">Over Label</label>
</FloatLabel>

<FloatLabel variant="in">
    <InputNumber v-model="value2" inputId="in_label" mode="currency" currency="USD" locale="en-US" variant="filled" />
    <label for="in_label">In Label</label>
</FloatLabel>

<FloatLabel variant="on">
    <InputNumber v-model="value3" inputId="on_label" mode="currency" currency="USD" locale="en-US" />
    <label for="on_label">On Label</label>
</FloatLabel>

sections.label: Fluid
sections.description: The fluid prop makes the component take up the full width of its container when set to true.

examples.basic: <InputNumber v-model="value" fluid mode="currency" currency="USD" locale="en-US" />

sections.label: Forms
sections.description: InputNumber integrates seamlessly with the PrimeVue Forms library.

examples.basic: {{ $form.amount.error?.message }}

sections.label: Ifta Label
sections.description: IftaLabel is used to create infield top aligned labels. Visit IftaLabel documentation for more information.

examples.basic:
<IftaLabel>
    <InputNumber v-model="value" inputId="price_input" mode="currency" currency="USD" locale="en-US" variant="filled" />
    <label for="price_input">Price</label>
</IftaLabel>
import InputNumber from 'primevue/inputnumber';

sections.label: Invalid
sections.description: Invalid state is displayed using the invalid prop to indicate a failed validation. You can use this style when integrating with form validation libraries.

examples.basic:
<InputNumber v-model="value1" :invalid="value1 === null" mode="decimal" :minFractionDigits="2" placeholder="Amount" />
<InputNumber v-model="value2" :invalid="value2 === null" mode="decimal" :minFractionDigits="2" variant="filled" placeholder="Amount" />

sections.label: Locale
sections.description: Localization information such as grouping and decimal symbols are defined with the locale property which defaults to the user locale.

examples.basic:
<InputNumber v-model="value1" inputId="locale-user" :minFractionDigits="2" fluid />
<InputNumber v-model="value2" inputId="locale-us" locale="en-US" :minFractionDigits="2" fluid />
<InputNumber v-model="value3" inputId="locale-german" locale="de-DE" :minFractionDigits="2" fluid />
<InputNumber v-model="value4" inputId="locale-indian" locale="en-IN" :minFractionDigits="2" fluid />

sections.label: Numerals
sections.description: InputNumber is used with the v-model property for two-way value binding.

examples.basic:
<InputNumber v-model="value1" inputId="integeronly" fluid />
<InputNumber v-model="value2" inputId="withoutgrouping" :useGrouping="false" fluid />
<InputNumber v-model="value3" inputId="minmaxfraction" :minFractionDigits="2" :maxFractionDigits="5" fluid />
<InputNumber v-model="value4" inputId="minmax" :min="0" :max="100" fluid />

sections.label: Prefix & Suffix
sections.description: Custom texts e.g. units can be placed before or after the input section with the prefix and suffix properties.

examples.basic:
<InputNumber v-model="value1" inputId="mile" suffix=" mi" fluid />
<InputNumber v-model="value2" inputId="percent" prefix="%" fluid />
<InputNumber v-model="value3" inputId="expiry" prefix="Expires in " suffix=" days" fluid />
<InputNumber v-model="value4" inputId="temperature" prefix="↑ " suffix="" :min="0" :max="40" fluid />

sections.label: Sizes
sections.description: InputNumber provides small and large sizes as alternatives to the base.

examples.basic:
<InputNumber v-model="value1" size="small" placeholder="Small" mode="currency" currency="USD" locale="en-US" />
<InputNumber v-model="value2" placeholder="Normal" mode="currency" currency="USD" locale="en-US" />
<InputNumber v-model="value3" size="large" placeholder="Large" mode="currency" currency="USD" locale="en-US" />

sections.label: Vertical
sections.description: Buttons can also placed vertically by setting buttonLayout as vertical .

examples.basic:
<InputNumber v-model="value" showButtons buttonLayout="vertical" style="width: 3rem" :min="0" :max="99">
    <template #incrementbuttonicon>
        <span class="pi pi-plus" />
    </template>
    <template #decrementbuttonicon>
        <span class="pi pi-minus" />
    </template>
</InputNumber>

props.name: modelValue
props.description: Value of the component.

props.name: defaultValue
props.description: The default value for the input when not controlled by  `modelValue` .

props.name: name
props.description: The name attribute for the element, typically used in form submissions.

props.name: format
props.description: Whether to format the value.

props.name: showButtons
props.description: Displays spinner buttons.

props.name: buttonLayout
props.description: Layout of the buttons.

props.name: incrementButtonClass
props.description: Style class of the increment button.

props.name: decrementButtonClass
props.description: Style class of the decrement button.

props.name: incrementButtonIcon
props.description: Style class of the increment icon.

props.name: incrementIcon
props.description: Style class of the increment icon.

props.name: decrementButtonIcon
props.description: Style class of the decrement icon.

props.name: decrementIcon
props.description: Style class of the decrement icon.

props.name: locale
props.description: Locale to be used in formatting.

props.name: localeMatcher
props.description:
The locale matching algorithm to use. Possible values are 'lookup' and 'best fit'; the default is 'best fit'.
See [Locale Negotation](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Intl#locale_negotiation) for details.

props.name: mode
props.description: Defines the behavior of the component.

props.name: prefix
props.description: Text to display before the value.

props.name: suffix
props.description: Text to display after the value.

props.name: currency
props.description:
The currency to use in currency formatting. Possible values are the [ISO 4217 currency codes](https://www.six-group.com/en/products-services/financial-information/data-standards.html#scrollTo=maintenance-agency), such as 'USD' for the US dollar, 'EUR' for the euro, or 'CNY' for the Chinese RMB.
There is no default value; if the style is 'currency', the currency property must be provided.

props.name: currencyDisplay
props.description: How to display the currency in currency formatting. Possible values are 'symbol' to use a localized currency symbol such as , 'code' to use the ISO currency code, 'name' to use a localized currency name such as 'dollar'.

props.name: useGrouping
props.description: Whether to use grouping separators, such as thousands separators or thousand/lakh/crore separators.

props.name: minFractionDigits
props.description:
The minimum number of fraction digits to use. Possible values are from 0 to 20; the default for plain number and percent formatting is 0;
the default for currency formatting is the number of minor unit digits provided by the [ISO 4217 currency code](https://www.six-group.com/en/products-services/financial-information/data-standards.html#scrollTo=maintenance-agency) list (2 if the list doesn't provide that information).

props.name: maxFractionDigits
props.description:
The maximum number of fraction digits to use. Possible values are from 0 to 20; the default for plain number formatting is the larger of minimumFractionDigits and 3;
the default for currency formatting is the larger of minimumFractionDigits and the number of minor unit digits provided by the [ISO 4217 currency code](https://www.six-group.com/en/products-services/financial-information/data-standards.html#scrollTo=maintenance-agency) list (2 if the list doesn't provide that information).

props.name: roundingMode
props.description:
How decimals should be rounded.
The default value is  `"halfExpand"` , [further information](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Intl/NumberFormat/NumberFormat#roundingmode).

props.name: min
props.description: Minimum boundary value.

props.name: max
props.description: Maximum boundary value.

props.name: step
props.description: Step factor to increment/decrement the value.

props.name: allowEmpty
props.description: Determines whether the input field is empty.

props.name: highlightOnFocus
props.description: Highlights automatically the input value.

props.name: showClear
props.description: When enabled, a clear icon is displayed to clear the value.

props.name: size
props.description: Defines the size of the component.

props.name: invalid
props.description: When present, it specifies that the component should have invalid state style.

props.name: disabled
props.description: When present, it specifies that the component should be disabled.

props.name: variant
props.description: Specifies the input variant of the component.

props.name: readonly
props.description: When present, it specifies that an input field is read-only.

props.name: placeholder
props.description: Placeholder text for the input.

props.name: fluid
props.description: Spans 100% width of the container when enabled.

props.name: inputId
props.description: Identifier of the focus input to match a label defined for the chips.

props.name: inputClass
props.description: Style class of the input field.

props.name: inputStyle
props.description: Inline style of the input field.

props.name: ariaLabelledby
props.description: Establishes relationships between the component and label(s) where its value should be one or more element IDs.

props.name: ariaLabel
props.description: Establishes a string value that labels the component.

props.name: formControl
props.description: Form control object, typically used for handling validation and form state.

props.name: dt
props.description: It generates scoped CSS variables using design tokens for the component.

props.name: pt
props.description: Used to pass attributes to DOM elements inside the component.

props.name: ptOptions
props.description: Used to configure passthrough(pt) options of the component.

props.name: unstyled
props.description: When enabled, it removes component related styles in the core.

pt.name: root
pt.description: Used to pass attributes to the root's DOM element.

pt.name: pcInputText
pt.description: Used to pass attributes to the InputText component.

pt.name: clearIcon
pt.description: Used to pass attributes to the label's DOM element.

pt.name: buttonGroup
pt.description: Used to pass attributes to the button group's DOM element.

pt.name: incrementButton
pt.description: Used to pass attributes to the increment button's DOM element.

pt.name: incrementIcon
pt.description: Used to pass attributes to the increment icon's DOM element.

pt.name: decrementButton
pt.description: Used to pass attributes to the decrement button's DOM element.

pt.name: decrementIcon
pt.description: Used to pass attributes to the decrement icon's DOM element.

pt.name: hooks
pt.description: Used to manage all lifecycle hooks.

components.name: inputotp
components.title: Vue Otp Input Component
components.description: Input Otp is used to enter one time passwords.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Input OTP uses a set of InputText components, refer to the InputText component for more information about the screen reader support. Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus to the input otp. right arrow Moves focus to the next input element. left arrow Moves focus to the previous input element. backspace Deletes the input and moves focus to the previous input element.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: InputOtp is used with the v-model property for two-way value binding. The number of characters is defined with the length option, which is set to 4 by default.

examples.basic: <InputOtp v-model="value" />

sections.label: Filled

        <input type="text" v-bind="attrs" v-on="events" class="custom-otp-input" />

</InputOtp>

props.name: aria-activedescendant
props.description: Identifies the currently active element when DOM focus is on a composite widget, textbox, group, or application.

props.name: aria-atomic
props.description: Indicates whether assistive technologies will present all, or only parts of, the changed region based on the change notifications defined by the aria-relevant attribute.

props.name: aria-autocomplete
props.description:
Indicates whether inputting text could trigger display of one or more predictions of the user's intended value for an input and specifies how predictions would be
presented if they are made.

props.name: aria-busy
props.description: Indicates an element is being modified and that assistive technologies MAY want to wait until the modifications are complete before exposing them to the user.

props.name: aria-checked
props.description: Indicates the current "checked" state of checkboxes, radio buttons, and other widgets.

props.name: aria-colcount
props.description: Defines the total number of columns in a table, grid, or treegrid.

props.name: aria-colindex
props.description: Defines an element's column index or position with respect to the total number of columns within a table, grid, or treegrid.

props.name: aria-colspan
props.description: Defines the number of columns spanned by a cell or gridcell within a table, grid, or treegrid.

props.name: aria-controls
props.description: Identifies the element (or elements) whose contents or presence are controlled by the current element.

props.name: aria-current
props.description: Indicates the element that represents the current item within a container or set of related elements.

props.name: aria-describedby
props.description: Identifies the element (or elements) that describes the object.

props.name: aria-details
props.description: Identifies the element that provides a detailed, extended description for the object.

props.name: aria-disabled
props.description: Indicates that the element is perceivable but disabled, so it is not editable or otherwise operable.

props.name: aria-dropeffect
props.description: Indicates what functions can be performed when a dragged object is released on the drop target.

props.name: aria-errormessage
props.description: Identifies the element that provides an error message for the object.

props.name: aria-expanded
props.description: Indicates whether the element, or another grouping element it controls, is currently expanded or collapsed.

props.name: aria-flowto
props.description:
Identifies the next element (or elements) in an alternate reading order of content which, at the user's discretion,
allows assistive technology to override the general default of reading in document source order.

props.name: aria-grabbed
props.description: Indicates an element's "grabbed" state in a drag-and-drop operation.

props.name: aria-haspopup
props.description: Indicates the availability and type of interactive popup element, such as menu or dialog, that can be triggered by an element.

props.name: aria-hidden
props.description: Indicates whether the element is exposed to an accessibility API.

props.name: aria-invalid
props.description: Indicates the entered value does not conform to the format expected by the application.

props.name: aria-keyshortcuts
props.description: Indicates keyboard shortcuts that an author has implemented to activate or give focus to an element.

props.name: aria-label
props.description: Defines a string value that labels the current element.

props.name: aria-labelledby
props.description: Identifies the element (or elements) that labels the current element.

props.name: aria-level
props.description: Defines the hierarchical level of an element within a structure.

props.name: aria-live
props.description: Indicates that an element will be updated, and describes the types of updates the user agents, assistive technologies, and user can expect from the live region.

props.name: aria-modal
props.description: Indicates whether an element is modal when displayed.

props.name: aria-multiline
props.description: Indicates whether a text box accepts multiple lines of input or only a single line.

props.name: aria-multiselectable
props.description: Indicates that the user may select more than one item from the current selectable descendants.

props.name: aria-orientation
props.description: Indicates whether the element's orientation is horizontal, vertical, or unknown/ambiguous.

props.name: aria-owns
props.description:
Identifies an element (or elements) in order to define a visual, functional, or contextual parent/child relationship
between DOM elements where the DOM hierarchy cannot be used to represent the relationship.

props.name: aria-placeholder
props.description:
Defines a short hint (a word or short phrase) intended to aid the user with data entry when the control has no value.
A hint could be a sample value or a brief description of the expected format.

props.name: aria-posinset
props.description: Defines an element's number or position in the current set of listitems or treeitems. Not required if all elements in the set are present in the DOM.

props.name: aria-pressed
props.description: Indicates the current "pressed" state of toggle buttons.

props.name: aria-readonly
props.description: Indicates that the element is not editable, but is otherwise operable.

props.name: aria-relevant
props.type: "text" | "additions" | "additions removals" | "additions text" | "all" | "removals" | "removals additions" | "removals text" | "text additions" | "text removals"
props.description: Indicates what notifications the user agent will trigger when the accessibility tree within a live region is modified.

props.name: aria-required
props.description: Indicates that user input is required on the element before a form may be submitted.

props.name: aria-roledescription
props.description: Defines a human-readable, author-localized description for the role of an element.

props.name: aria-rowcount
props.description: Defines the total number of rows in a table, grid, or treegrid.

props.name: aria-rowindex
props.description: Defines an element's row index or position with respect to the total number of rows within a table, grid, or treegrid.

props.name: aria-rowspan
props.description: Defines the number of rows spanned by a cell or gridcell within a table, grid, or treegrid.

props.name: aria-selected
props.description: Indicates the current "selected" state of various widgets.

props.name: aria-setsize
props.description: Defines the number of items in the current set of listitems or treeitems. Not required if all elements in the set are present in the DOM.

props.name: aria-sort
props.description: Indicates if items in a table or grid are sorted in ascending or descending order.

props.name: aria-valuemax
props.description: Defines the maximum allowed value for a range widget.

props.name: aria-valuemin
props.description: Defines the minimum allowed value for a range widget.

props.name: aria-valuenow
props.description: Defines the current value for a range widget.

props.name: aria-valuetext
props.description: Defines the human readable text alternative of aria-valuenow for a range widget.

props.name: inputmode
props.description: Hints at the type of data that might be entered by the user while editing the element or its contents

props.name: is
props.description: Specify that a standard HTML element should behave like a defined custom built-in element

props.name: modelValue
props.description: Value of the component.

props.name: defaultValue
props.description: The default value for the input when not controlled by  `modelValue` .

props.name: name
props.description: The name attribute for the element, typically used in form submissions.

props.name: size
props.description: Defines the size of the component.

props.name: invalid
props.description: When present, it specifies that the component should have invalid state style.

props.name: variant
props.description: Specifies the input variant of the component.

props.name: fluid
props.description: Spans 100% width of the container when enabled.

props.name: formControl
props.description: Form control object, typically used for handling validation and form state.

props.name: dt
props.description: It generates scoped CSS variables using design tokens for the component.

props.name: pt
props.description: Used to pass attributes to DOM elements inside the component.

props.name: ptOptions
props.description: Used to configure passthrough(pt) options of the component.

props.name: unstyled
props.description: When enabled, it removes component related styles in the core.

pt.name: root
pt.description: Used to pass attributes to the root's DOM element.

pt.name: hooks
pt.description: Used to manage all lifecycle hooks.

styles.description: The class of root element

components.name: keyfilter
components.title: Vue KeyFilter Component
components.description: A keyfilter is a directive used to block individual keystrokes based on a pattern.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: KeyFilter is a directive and do not require any accessibility features.

examples.basic:
import KeyFilter from 'primevue/keyfilter';

app.directive('keyfilter', KeyFilter);

sections.label: Presets
sections.description: KeyFilter provides various presets configured with the v-keyfilter directive.

examples.basic:
<InputText v-keyfilter.int />
<InputText v-keyfilter.num />
<InputText v-keyfilter.money />
<InputText v-keyfilter.hex />
<InputText v-keyfilter.alpha />
<InputText v-keyfilter.alphanum />

sections.label: Regex (Single Keypress)
sections.description: In addition to the presets, a regular expression can be configured for customization of blocking a single key press.

examples.basic:
<InputText v-model="spacekey" v-keyfilter="/[^\s]/" />
<InputText v-model="chars" v-keyfilter="/^[^<>*!]+$/" />

sections.label: Regex (Whole Word)
sections.description: In addition to the presets, a regular expression can be used to validate the entire word using validateOnly option.

examples.basic: <InputText v-model="text" v-keyfilter="{ pattern: /^[+]?(\d{1,12})?$/, validateOnly: true }" />

components.name: knob
components.title: Vue Knob Component
components.description: Knob is a form component to define number inputs with a dial.

sections.label: Accessibility
sections.description: Screen Reader Knob element component uses slider role in addition to the aria-valuemin , aria-valuemax and aria-valuenow attributes. Value to describe the component can be defined using aria-labelledby and aria-label props. Keyboard Support Key Function tab Moves focus to the slider. left arrow down arrow Decrements the value. right arrow up arrow Increments the value. home Set the minimum value. end Set the maximum value. page up Increments the value by 10 steps. page down Decrements the value by 10 steps.

examples.basic: Number

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Knob is used with the v-model property for two-way value binding.

examples.basic: <Knob v-model="value" />

sections.label: Color
sections.description: valueColor defines the value color, rangeColor defines the range background and similarly textColor configures the color of the value text. In addition, strokeWidth is used to determine the width of the stroke of range and value sections.

examples.basic: <Knob v-model="value" valueColor="SlateGray" rangeColor="MediumTurquoise" />

sections.label: Disabled
sections.description: When disabled is present, a visual hint is applied to indicate that the Knob cannot be interacted with.

examples.basic: <Knob v-model="value" disabled />

sections.label: Forms
sections.description: Knob integrates seamlessly with the PrimeVue Forms library.

examples.basic: {{ $form.knob.error?.message }}
import Knob from 'primevue/knob';

sections.label: Min/Max
sections.description: Boundaries are configured with the min and max values whose defaults are 0 and 100 respectively.

examples.basic: <Knob v-model="value" :min="-50" :max="50" />

sections.label: Reactive
sections.description: Knob can be controlled with custom controls as well.

sections.label: ReadOnly
sections.description: When readonly present, value cannot be edited.

examples.basic: <Knob v-model="value" readonly />

sections.label: Size
sections.description: Diameter of the knob is defined in pixels using the size property.

examples.basic: <Knob v-model="value" :size="200" />

sections.label: Step
sections.description: Step factor is 1 by default and can be customized with step option.

examples.basic: <Knob v-model="value5" :step="10" />

sections.label: Stroke
sections.description: The border size is specified with the stroke property as a number in pixels.

examples.basic: <Knob v-model="value" :strokeWidth="5" />

sections.label: Template
sections.description: The label can be customized with the valueTemplate property using either a template string or a function.

examples.basic: <Knob v-model="value" valueTemplate="{value}%" />
